text: The Ven. Henry William Harper, MA'Multiple News Items' The Standard (London, England), Monday, October 12, 1863; pg. 3; Issue 12221 (1833NTETC – 20 January 1922) was an eminent New Zealand Anglican priest in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.Project Canterbury He was the eldest son of Henry Harper, the Primate of New Zealand. He was educated at Eton CollegeWJO and Trinity College, Oxford and ordained in 1858.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1908 p82: London, Herbert Cox, 1908 After a curacy at Waimakariri he was Vicar of Hokitika then Timaru.‘HARPER, Ven. Henry William’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 1 Nov 2014 He was Archdeacon of Timaru from 1875 toSt Mary's (Anglican) Parish Church, Timaru, N.Z. 1911\. He died on 20 January 1922.The Venerable H. W. Harper. The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Jan 25, 1922; pg. 12; Issue 42938. ==References== Category:1833 births Category:People educated at Eton College Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Oxford Category:Archdeacons of Timaru Category:1922 deaths
title: Henry Harper (priest)
